description: This function generates a scatter plot of points in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane. It is designed for educational purposes, specifically to help students understand the concept of coordinates, plotting points and interpreting scatter plots.

educational_standards.description: Explain the reasons behind the observed relationships between corresponding terms in two numerical patterns, generated from given rules and organized into ordered pairs.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Scatter Plots in Quadrant One
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function 'plot_points_quadrant_one_with_context' is capable of generating scatter plots in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane. It accepts a 'stimulus_description' object which includes the titles for the x and y axes and a list of points to plot. Each point has a label, and x and y coordinates. The function calculates the maximum x and y values from the points, and uses these to determine the step size for the x and y axes. The function also includes a grid for easier interpretation of the plot. The educational purpose of this function is to help students understand the concept of coordinates, how to plot points on a Cartesian plane, and how to interpret scatter plots.

details: x_title: The title for the x-axis
y_title: The title for the y-axis
points: A list of points to plot. Each point includes a label, and x and y coordinates
All x and y coordinates must be non-negative, as the function only plots points in the first quadrant
The label for each point is required
The function generates a scatter plot in the first quadrant of a Cartesian plane
Each point is labeled and plotted according to its x and y coordinates
The x and y axes are labeled according to the 'x_title' and 'y_title' parameters
A grid is included for easier interpretation of the plot
